result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa J Woods was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *Fine of $600.00  including costs to be paid FROM BAIL AND $100.00 FORTHWITH   or serve 15 CONSECUITVE  days in the House of Correction.

12-30-15 / Judge John Siefert
The Court ordered the JOC to be amended to reflect one day credit against the sentence, not three.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK AND CHILD CARE. CAN BE SERVED ON ES.   COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 12-28-15.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa J Woods

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Corrected (same day) to 1 days sentence credit, not 3 days
Defendant Lisa J Woods not in court.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court ordered judgment of conviction to be amended to reflect one day credit against the sentence, not three.
F&C Commitment issued for failure to pay.  15 days HOC,  consecutive.   Due & owing

Defendant Lisa J Woods in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  90 DAYS  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply FOR WORK AND CHILD CARE. CAN BE SERVED ON ES.   COURT STAYED THE COMMENCMENT UNTIL 12-28-15  .

Fine of $600.00  including costs to be paid FROM BAIL AND $100.00 FORTHWITH   or serve 15 CONSECUITVE  days in the House of Correction.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Lisa J Woods in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense motion to adjourn is granted by the court.  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Lisa J Woods in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Lisa J Woods in court with attorney James Edgar Toran.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lisa J Woods in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status  on counsel    in Branch 47. LR  Status conference scheduled for 09-23-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Lisa J Woods in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.
records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lisa J Woods in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for pretrial conference in Branch 47. lr  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 09-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Lisa J Woods in court.  Anthony E. White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 47.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 6/22/15 @ 1:30pm
